SEARCH
Package com.groq.sdk.resources

Class FilesResource

java.lang.Object
com.groq.sdk.resources.FilesResource
public class FilesResource extends Object
Provides access to file operations in the Groq API. Handles file upload, retrieval, listing, and deletion with comprehensive error handling and multipart support.
Since:
04-Oct-2025
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mr. XYZ

  • Constructor Details

    • FilesResource

      public FilesResource(GroqClient client)
      Constructs a new FilesResource with the specified GroqClient.
      Parameters:
      client - the GroqClient instance to use for API calls

  • Method Details

    • list

      public GroqResponse<FileList> list()
      Lists all available files.
      Returns:
      the API response containing the list of files
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • upload

      public GroqResponse<FileObject> upload(FileUploadRequest request)
      Uploads a file using multipart form data.
      Parameters:
      request - the file upload request containing file content and purpose
      Returns:
      the API response containing the uploaded file details
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if request is null, purpose is empty, or file content is empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • retrieve

      public GroqResponse<FileObject> retrieve(String fileId)
      Retrieves a specific file by ID.
      Parameters:
      fileId - the unique identifier of the file to retrieve
      Returns:
      the API response containing the file details
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if file ID is null or empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • delete

      public GroqResponse<FileDeleteResponse> delete(String fileId)
      Deletes a specific file by ID.
      Parameters:
      fileId - the unique identifier of the file to delete
      Returns:
      the API response confirming the deletion
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if file ID is null or empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • retrieveContent

      public GroqResponse<String> retrieveContent(String fileId)
      Retrieves the content of a specific file by ID.
      Parameters:
      fileId - the unique identifier of the file whose content to retrieve
      Returns:
      the API response containing the file content as string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if file ID is null or empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • uploadStringContent

      public GroqResponse<FileObject> uploadStringContent(String content, String filename, String purpose)
      Uploads string content as a file.
      Parameters:
      content - the string content to upload
      filename - the name for the uploaded file
      purpose - the purpose of the file upload
      Returns:
      the API response containing the uploaded file details
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if content is empty, filename is empty, or purpose is empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails

    • uploadJson

      public GroqResponse<FileObject> uploadJson(String jsonContent, String filename, String purpose)
      Uploads JSON content as a file.
      Parameters:
      jsonContent - the JSON content to upload
      filename - the base name for the JSON file (".json" extension will be added if missing)
      purpose - the purpose of the file upload
      Returns:
      the API response containing the uploaded file details
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if JSON content is empty
      RuntimeException - if the API call fails
